title: An Unconventional Officer
description: It is 1808, the coldest winter Yorkshire had seen for years, and in the middle of a snowstorm two people meet.Major Paul van Daan is a rising star in the British army, posted to Yorkshire to sort out the chaos of the 115th North Yorkshire regiment. He’s arrogant, clever and has an unconventional attitude to army life but he comes from a wealthy family and has the support and patronage of Sir Arthur Wellesley. He’s married with two small children but he still has an eye for a pretty girl.Anne Howard is seventeen. She's wayward, intelligent, beautiful and doesn’t give a damn about how young ladies are supposed to behave.For Paul and Anne through that magical spring, nothing or nobody else matters. When he leaves, Anne never expects to see him again. But England is at war and on a transport to Portugal, Paul and Anne meet again.Welcome to the 110th infantry, to a land at war, and an army which even their general called “the scum of the earth”.Welcome to a love story.An Unconventional Officer is the first book in the Peninsular War Saga which follows the fortunes of the 110th through Portugal, Spain and France.
author: Lynn Bryant
